Article.ArticleTitle: Long COVID: aiming for a consensus.

AffiliationInfo.Affiliation: Department of Paediatrics and Paediatric Infectious Diseases, Institute of Child's Health, Sechenov First Moscow State Medical University, Moscow, Russia; Inflammation, Repair and Development Section, National Heart and Lung Institute, Faculty of Medicine, Imperial College London, London W2 1PG, UK. Electronic address: daniel.munblit08@imperial.ac.uk.
Long Covid Support, University College London, London, UK.
Sainsbury Wellcome Centre, University College London, London, UK; Patient-Led Research Collaborative, Washington, DC, USA.
Institute of Archaeology, University College London, London, UK.
ISARIC Global Support Centre, Pandemic Sciences Institute, University of Oxford, Oxford, UK.

Pulmonary and Critical Care Medicine, Department of Medicine, and Department of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation, School of Medicine, and Outcomes After Critical Illness and Surgery (OACIS) Research Group, Johns Hopkins University, Baltimore, MD, USA.

MedlineCitation.CoiStatement: DM reports grants from the British Embassy in Moscow, UKRI/NIHR, and the Russian Foundation for basic research funding projects related to COVID-19 and long COVID. DM is also a co-chair of the ISARIC Global Paediatric long COVID working group and member of the ISARIC working group on long-term follow-up in adults as well as co-lead of the PC-COS and PC-COS paediatric projects aiming to define the core outcome set for long COVID. DMN is a co-lead of the PC-COS project aiming to define the core outcome set for long COVID. EP reports being a Long Covid Kids Champion (an unpaid, volunteer role aimed at facilitating the recognition of long Covid in paediatric patients) for the charity Long Covid Kids. All other authors declare no competing interests.
